line_1: And what great William since has built;
A lofty dome to Belus first she built:
line_2: The inward roof with dazling silver gilt;

line_1: YOU told me, I remember, glory built
line_2: On selfish principles, is shame and guilt.

line_1: His was true courage on good prudence built —
line_2: 'Twas only rais'd to crush presuming guilt,

line_1: But chiefly Love — to Love an Altar built,
line_2: Of twelve vast French Romances, neatly gilt.

line_1: Prisons expect the wicked, and were built
line_2: To bind the lawless and to punish guilt,

line_1: FOR Socrates a House was built,
line_2: Not highly Arch'd, nor Carv'd, nor Gilt;

line_1: While on delusive hopes they fondly built,
